summary: This memorandum outlines an operational plan for CIA actions against Cuba for the predictable future, focusing on intelligence efforts and long-term operations. It assumes no US invasion or support for a revolt, limited paramilitary actions, and a continued Castro regime. The plan aims to isolate and discredit the regime, maintain economic and political pressures, and gather intelligence. It includes espionage, sabotage, and psychological warfare strategies, along with recommendations for organizational changes and actions.
title: Operational Plan for Continuing Operations Against Cuba
